page.title: 06Dairy Farming. Kingsbury.
page.content: {Cattle Food} In a barn we saw 43 bales of hay which had been collected from 3 acres.Hay is grass which has been cut and dried for 5 days before it is baled.It is used for feeding the cattle which come in first for the winter.The bales of hay are cylindrical.They are about 1 metre in diameter and about one and a half metres long.{ {Silage} In the yard we saw a pile of large black polythene bags covered with netting.These contain silage.Silage is grass which is stored while it is wet. The netting is to protect the bags from birds and small animals,as the silage would be spoiled if air got into the bags. {Bedding} We saw bales of shredded newspaper (unsold copies) now used for bedding.
